about.content: I discovered programming in 10th grade (equivalent to "seconde" in France) with Python. I loved the idea of being able to create anything with just lines of code. This marked the beginning of a long adventure!
I worked on my first projects and discovered new languages: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, C#. At the same time, I also started learning 3D animation, a field I am passionate about.

I completed my first concrete project, a game in Python with Tkinter for school. The project requirements were simple, but I enjoyed having no real limits other than my imagination and being able to implement the desired features.

I noticed that many people at my school use Discord. This gave me the idea to create a Discord bot to provide students with various information from the school's intranet, such as their schedule, homework, grades, and more. So I started working on EntOnDiscord ! This project is one of my favorites because it allowed me to learn many concepts like OOP, scraping, database management, and more.

I completed a second group project using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP. I really enjoyed this project because I was able to apply my 3D skills by creating all the images and videos and implementing 3D with Three.js.

Being very interested in projects that require thinking, I tried to create my first AI dedicated to TicTacToe without external libraries. It records all the games it plays and uses them to anticipate potential defeats and create winning opportunities.

I began learning mobile application development in Swift and completed my first mission as a mobile developer. This first experience taught me how to approach a client, establish requirements, and meet their needs.
While continuing my projects, I passed my specialty exams (High School Diploma) and achieved a score of 20/20 in Computer Science and 18/20 in Mathematics !

I traveled to the United States and had the opportunity to talk with several people in the IT field. I realized that this country best matched my expectations and offered the most opportunities to gain experience in IT. One of my goals is to work in the United States.
I participated in the entrance exam for 42: La Piscine. This experience allowed me to meet new people, discover different learning methods, and challenge myself with increasingly difficult problems.

I joined 42 after passing the entrance exam. The curriculum is divided into two parts: the common core and the specialization. The common core, which usually takes about a year and a half, began for me.
After 4 months and 16 intensive days, I completed the common core in record time, a first at 42 Paris. I am proud that my skills and acquired discipline have paid off.

I am now in the second part of my curriculum, the specialization. I continue working on projects to gain experience for the RNCP Level 7 (Master's Degree). At the same time, I secured my second freelance mission !

I am currently working on my online presence by creating elements like this portfolio, my resume, and more. My next goal is to find an internship abroad, which is required for obtaining the RNCP Level 7 (Master's Degree).

experiences.name: Developer Swift
experiences.description: As a former sneaker reseller, I identified a problem : the lack of a dedicated management application. I then contacted SamaraCG, the renowned private group specializing in sneaker reselling, to propose developing a management application for their members. My mission was to create this sneaker management application named WaveSpace.

experiences.name: Developer Swift
experiences.description: My mission was to create a prototype using the ScreenTime API to manage screen time. I had to utilize Swift concepts such as FamilyControls and DeviceActivityMonitor to manage the device's applications and perform background actions.

feedbacks.name: Said Guidirne
feedbacks.feedback: I've had the pleasure of working with this freelancer and I'm extremely satisfied with the quality of his work. He demonstrated his professionalism by answering all my questions promptly and always being available to discuss the details of the project.

feedbacks.name: Walhan
feedbacks.feedback: To be honest, WaveSpace is one of the best projects I've done with Theo (out of the many we've worked on together). It was an accounting management application specifically designed for trainer retailers, and I have to say I'm absolutely delighted with the result. Théo was very responsive whenever I needed changes or adjustments (with follow-up even after the application was finished). He always listens to my requests and understands my needs perfectly. In terms of value for money, WaveSpace is more than reasonable. Théo offers very competitive rates without ever sacrificing quality of service. He is also very understanding when it comes to budget issues. Overall, I would highly recommend working with Theo as it has been a positive and rewarding experience.
